member.name: T:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ControlStateInput
member.summary:
Creates a hidden input that is used to store control state information. See ClientLabel or ClientPanel for an example.
It generates the markup with the autocomplete="off" attribute so that the hidden input values are not remembered between page reloads.

member.name: T:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Control.CommonUserControl
member.summary: Base class for common user controls.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Control.CommonUserControl.SetNextTabIndex(System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl)
member.summary: Sets the next tab index for the control passed in provided StartTabIndex has been set to a number greater than -1.
member.param: The control to set the next tab index for.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Control.CommonUserControl.RegisterClientSideControlJavaScript(System.Type)
member.summary: Registers the controls client side object script file. Either the ClientScriptURL or the ClientScriptResourceName property must be set for this to have any effect. If both are specified, the ClientScriptResourceName takes precedence.
member.param: Optional. The type of control that is being registered. Default is whatever is returned from GetType().

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Control.CommonUserControl.GetControlClientId(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Convenience method to access CommonPage.GetControlClientId.

member.summary: Convenience method to access CommonPage.FocusControl.

member.summary: Convenience method to access CommonPage.GetRequestObject.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Control.CommonUserControl.SetRequestObject(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Convenience method to access CommonPage.SetRequestObject.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Control.CommonUserControl.CommonPage
member.summary: Returns the current page as type CommonPage. If the page is not of type CommonPage, then null is returned.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Control.CommonUserControl.ReadOnly
member.summary:
The read only status of this control. The status is saved in the ViewState.
The default is False.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Control.CommonUserControl.ClientInstanceName
member.summary:
This is the name of the instance of the JavaScript client side control if it exists. If this is specified, care needs to be taken that it is unique on the page.
The default is ClientID.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Control.CommonUserControl.RequestSenderId
member.summary: Convenience property to access CommonPage.RequestSenderId.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Control.CommonUserControl.RequestEventArgs
member.summary: Convenience property to access CommonPage.RequestEventArgs.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Control.CommonUserControl.StartTabIndex
member.summary: The tab index to start setting controls within this UserControl with.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Control.CommonUserControl.NextTabIndex
member.summary: Holds the next available tab index after all the controls on this UserControl have been set. All controls must have their tab index set by using SetNextTabIndex for this value to be accurate.

member.name: T:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Page.CommonPage
member.summary: Base class holding common Page properties and methods.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Page.CommonPage.GetControlClientId(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Returns the client id for the specified control. This can be overridden in the sub class to handle any other ways that a controls client id can be returned.
member.param: The control to get the client id for.
member.returns: A string holding the client id for the control passed in.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Page.CommonPage.FocusControl(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Sets focus to the specified control when the page is finished processing. This can be overridden in the sub class if focus should be set in a different way.
member.param: The control to set the focus too.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Page.CommonPage.GetRequestObject``1(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an object of the specified type from the Context.Items Dictionary. This Dictionary can be used to pass objects around to controls and pages during a request.
member.typeparam: The type of object to get.
member.returns: The object of the specified type if it exists. If it doesn't exist, null is returned.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Page.CommonPage.SetRequestObject(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets an object to the Context.Items Dictionary for the specified key. This Dictionary can be used to pass around objects to controls and other pages during a request.
member.param: The key of the object to save.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Page.CommonPage.RegisterCommonJavaScript(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers the Common.js JavaScript for use on the page.
member.param: The reference to the page object that is doing the registering.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Page.CommonPage.RequestSenderId
member.summary: Convenience property that returns the id of the object that sent this request. This is typically contained in the __EVENTTARGET request parameter.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.Page.CommonPage.RequestEventArgs
member.summary: Convenience property that returns the event argument for this request. This is typically contained in the __EVENTARGUMENT request parameter.

member.name: T:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientLabel
member.summary: A lable that can be modified using client side JavaScript. It will automatically retain its values during postbacks.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientLabel.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a ClientLabel instance.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientLabel.RegisterJavaScript
member.summary: Allows outside pages or controls to force the client side JavaScript to be registered after a postback. This function will be called automatically during the OnPreRender event if it is not called before hand.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientLabel.Required
member.summary: Flag for marking the label as required

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientLabel.RequiredCssClass
member.summary: The class to use for the generated span element for the required asterick. This will default to 'required_field' if this is not specified. So you can either specify the class you want to use or just add a class called 'required_field' to your style sheets.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientLabel.Text
member.summary: The text of the label.

member.name: T:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientPanel
member.summary: A panel that can be shown and hidden using client side JavaScript.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientPanel.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a ClientPanel instance.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientPanel.RegisterJavaScript
member.summary: Allows outside pages or controls to force the client side JavaScript to be registered after a postback. This function will be called automatically during the OnPreRender event if it is not called before hand.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientPanel.ContentTemplate
member.summary: Holds the markup for the inside of the ClientPanel div.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientPanel.Effect
member.summary: The effect to use when the ClientPanel is shown or hidden.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientPanel.EffectDuration
member.summary: The amount of time in milliseconds that the Effect will last. This value is valid for all effects except None.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientPanel.ClientVisible
member.summary: Flag holding whether the ClienPanel div is visible or not to begin with.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientPanel.CssClass
member.summary: The CSS class for the ClientPanel div.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientPanel.FocusControlId
member.summary: The unique control id of the control to set focus too when the ClientPanel div becomes visible.

member.name: T:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.ClientPanel.ClientPanelEffect
member.summary: Enum for different types of effects when the div is shown or hidden.

member.name: T:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox
member.summary: Allows for numeric only text entry into a text box. The text box will be formatted according to the settings specified.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a NumericTextBox instance.

member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.RegisterJavaScript
member.summary: Registers the client side javascript for this control. It will only be run once per request.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.DecimalPlaces
member.summary:
The number of decimal places to allow in the text box.
The default is 0.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.ForceDecimalPlaces
member.summary:
Whether or not to force the number of decimal places to be shown in the text box. For example, when true and DecimalPlaces is set to 3, then the number 3.2 will display as 3.200 in the text box. When this is false and DecimalPlaces is set to 3, then the number 3.200 will display as 3.2 in the text box.
The default is True.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.AllowBlank
member.summary:
Flag to allow the text box to be blank. When the text box is blank, the Value property can be null when returned. Otherwise, it is gauranteed to not be null.
The default is False.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.AllowNegative
member.summary:
Flag to allow negative values in the text box.
The default is True.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.UseNumberGroupSeparator
member.summary:
Flag to use the number group separator (a comma for us) when formatting for the text box. This number group separator is specified by CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.
For example, when true, the number 123456.67 will be displayed as 123,456.67 in the text box.
The default is True.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.PercentageMode
member.summary:
Flag to tell this control to work in percentages. When true, the Value property should be set using the decimal equivalent of the percentage to display. For example, to display 10, you would specify .01. Likewise, when true, the Value property is returned as the decimal equivalent of the percent. For example, if the text box is displaying 25.45, then .2545 will be returned.
The default is False.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.NumberFormatInfo
member.summary:
The NumberFormatInfo object for the culture for the display of the numbers.
The default is CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.NumberFormat.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.NumberTextBoxClientID
member.summary: The ClientID of the underlying text box.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.Text
member.summary: The actual text in the text box. Use Value, DoubleValue or IntValue to set the text.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.TextAlign
member.summary:
The alignment of the text in the box.
The default is Right.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.OnClientChange
member.summary: Used to specify the JavaScript to call when the value in the text box changes. This JavaScript is gauranteed to run after the value has already been formatted in the text box.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the value to display in the text box.
If PercentageMode is true, then this value should be specified as the decimal equivalent to the percentage. For example,10% should be specified as .01. Likewise, if PercentageMode is true, this value will be returned as the decimal equivalent of the percentage. For example, if the text box is showing 10, then .01 will be returned.
The client side object's functions for SetValue and GetValue work the same way.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.DoubleValue
member.summary: Convenience property to get/set the value using a double.

member.name: P:LoneWolf.Common.WebApp.WebControl.NumericTextBox.IntValue
member.summary: Convenience property to get/set the value as an int.
